Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Type B1 kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior glazed black; exterior: narrow brown line, with trace of second one, at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: A paper label is glued to the interior surface with the number 21 written in pencil; it is also written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration in the interior and exterior surfaces. According to Willliams, Type B1 kantharoi have two lines on the exterior surface of the sherd at the level of the handle root.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1697) (phase 2)
